name: The Westin Atlanta North at Perimeter

reviews.title: Pretty Lame for a Westin
reviews.text: The main reason I like Westin is because of consistent upkeep -- squeaky clean and well maintained. I was disappointed that my room at the Westin Atlanta North Perimeter had neither of those qualities. It was more like a beat-up old Sheraton. The best qualities were the room rate ($139), free parking, and close proximity of restaurants and stores.

reviews.title: Not up to Westin usual standards
reviews.text: The hotel’s common areas were fine, but my guest room was not typical of a Westin. Walls were scuffed, dinged, scraped, and stained. The furniture was old and worn. The carpet was worn and not particularly clean. Painting was sloppy. Linens were old and rough. The room and hallway had somewhat of an odor – never a good sign. Some surfaces were grimy; light-switches, for example, were filthy.

reviews.title: Fears put to rest
reviews.text: The room had the usual amenities: flatscreen TV, iron/ironing board, coffee, wireless internet, hair dryer, dual showerhead, and safe. No “Heavenly Robe.” While the bed was okay, it was not exactly the “heavenly” variety. The mini-bar was empty and a sign said that Westin is discontinuing mini-bars, probably because they finally realized that most people are not stupid enough to pay $5 for a candy bar.

reviews.title: Average Westin - which is to say Good"
reviews.text: Don’t get me wrong: The Westin Atlanta North is not a dirty hotel, but if you are accustomed to a certain standard from the Westin brand, you will be disappointed. There are other major hotels in the area, so I would suggest shopping around before deciding on this one.

reviews.title: Perfectly Fine Hotel
reviews.text: Hope this helps.

The rooms are small, most of the staff was rude and stuffy. Wi-Fi in the room was $12.95 A-DAY. The Lock on the room didn't work, The in-room fridge was EMPTY AND DID NOT WORK. The remote control was broken. To use the computer in the business center was a minimum of $3+ on a credit card to get started and $1 a page to print. The room was temp controlled so we slept without blankets although we set the thermostat @ 60 degrees. I hated this hotel. I will never book any Westin again.
reviews.title: A Four Star LIE!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: Yes the rooms are small, but I stayed here cheaper than a Red Roof Inn. Use the Priceline.com and this hotel is in region #18 in Atlanta. Choose 4-star hotel and bid. You can get this one cheap during the week.
reviews.title: Book this on Priceline, saved 75%. Awesome deal!

reviews.text: I agree for a 4-star hotel, the knob on the hot water on my sink fell off and the handel in the shower fell off. Needs a little love, but very, very adequate. DO NOT PAY $200 to stay here. USE PRICELINE !!!!
reviews.title: Don't stay here!

reviews.text: The beds are HEAVENLY and very COMFORTABLE.
reviews.title: Slept like a baby, but there are some things to watch for

reviews.text: Despite a reservation,I arrived to find they had oversold rooms and I was directed to the 'hospitality suite.' It was neither hospital nor sweet. A pull=out bed, no bedding, a tv remote that didn't work, someone else's hair in the shower, and the room smelled of more spilled beer than a Wisconsin tavern. The next day my luggage was moved to a room with a real bed. The room configuration was just like a Comfort Inn -- only this room was dirtier. Everything seems tired and worn out. And honestly, no one really seems to care. Don't do it. There are plenty of other options in the area. Stay somewhere else!
reviews.title: The name says alot, but the building says even more.
Not up to Westin Standards
reviews.text: My girlfriend and I stayed at this Westin over the 4th of July weekend. We weren't impressed. The room was very small, I mean, very small! It really wasn't cleaned well, the walls were sort of falling apart in the room too. The location is good, and the parking situation outside the hotel is convenient (ie. there is no need to valet), but other than that we were disappointed. The pool was also a huge disappointment. There were a total of 8 chairs around the pool area, and they were always taken. The was plenty of room for more chairs, but they just weren't there. With the ample amount of quality hotels in the Atlanta area for reasonable prices, there is no way I'd stay here again

reviews.title: A True Disappointment!
reviews.text: We are relocating to AZ and stopped in Atlanta for the night. We have never had a bad experience at a Westin until now. This hotel was subpar at best. The rooms were not cleaned well. The draperies were stained with who knows what and there was dust and grime in every nook and cranny. In addition, the calibur of people in the hotel was a little shocking. I am originally from Atlanta and could not believe the people "hanging out" at the hotel. Would not recommend!

reviews.title: Ohhh so very Unclean!!!
reviews.text: Started off with a very friendly staff from the front door to the check-in desk. Downhill from the sliding of my room key. A very stale odor greeted our nostrils as we opedned the door, as if the room had been locked away from the public for a few years. The large television was excellent as we started through the room, so with my manly short term memory the journey continued with renewed hope. Cords, tangled and chaotic, dangling behind a cup ring stained desk was next to catch my eye. Beside it was a slumping, sloppy chas lounge around 5 years past its prime. My optomism began to deminish. I had to continuously bump down the thermostat until I reached a 60 degree stop (as low as it would go) that barely kept the sweat at bay. Later that night after my shower to freshen up I noticed the body towels ranging the color spectrum from off white to a slight grey also varied in size and shape. It was strange, and I've never seen this before at any other hotel. I then noticed the shower and bathroom tile could definitely use some Scrubbing Bubbles and a little (or maybe alot) of elbow grease. I left the bathroom and walked around the room in my fresh out of the suitcase socks for 10-15 minutes getting ready for bed. As I laid down my wife made a ghastly discovery!! My fresh socks had changed from a good clean white color to a very dark greyish color. Disgusting!!! Overall, the cleanliness was 1 star maybe 2 masked by 5 stars worth of friendlyness. Very Dissatisfied.

reviews.title: Great premisis - awful service
reviews.text: The Hotel is very nice - has great rooms - spacious, very clean, very comfortable beds. No free internet. Also breakfast is good and the lobby is very cool. But the staff is useless. They just don't care. The light on my desk was broken. It took them 4 calls until someone bothered to show up. Delivering a bathrobe to the room took over an hour. Asking for support with the internet took hours. Whatever you interact with them - it won't work

reviews.title: Wifi is terrible and the rooms are retro-fitted hampton inns.
reviews.text: This is not a nice hotel.

The hotel is a 20-story structure on the back side of a quiet office park. It is about one-half mile to the other side of the office park where there is a grocery store and 3 or 4 restaurants. About one mile away is a MARTA subway stop and a large shopping mall. I was impressed by the quality of the room and hotel. The hotel is in a quiet location on the edge of a small lake. The room was spacious and in excellent condition. The bed was very comfortable. As a tourist, there is not much to see in this part of Atlanta, but the hotel is close to both the perimeter interstate loop and the highway 400 toll road that goes into Atlanta. Parking is free. Wi-fi access is expensive. Starbucks coffee available in the room for brewing (free), or in the lobby for purchase. Large HD TV with HBO.
reviews.title: very nice

reviews.text: My only complaint, other than wi-fi fees, is the loud group that was on my floor. The discount rates, especially on weekends, seems to bring in people who don't know that you shouldn't socialize in the hallways.
reviews.title: Great, place, Great food, Great breakfast

reviews.text: This hotel is very nice, customer service was on point and the food was very good. We travel a lot across the world and am a picky eater (mostly buy from Wholefoods) but I really put on pounds here; breakfast was awesome and the staff there were amazing, though there is one or so who always want to spoil the party. Overall, I will give it to this hotel, and did I mention I got a good deal on the price....!
reviews.title: A real disappointment.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2010, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: I traveled to this hotel last year and unfortunately, my company has booked this hotel for our meeting again. I'm so not looking forward to it.
reviews.title: Not Westin quality.

reviews.text: This hotel left a bad taste in my mouth from the moment I checked in. The front desk staff were not friendly nor welcoming. The rooms were (as many have stated on here) tiny, dingy and in need of updating. The headboard veneer was peeling and a piece actually fell on my head while I was sleeping. And the head of the bed seemed higher than the foot of the bed, so I was sleeping on a reverse incline (warning to those with acid reflux!). The chaise lounge looked (as my fiance put it) like a prop from a porn flick. It was dirty, stained and sagging. I didn't even want to put my luggage on it, let alone my body. I understand hotels charging for internet in the room (though I think $12.95 is a bit ridiculous) but offering NO free access in the lobby?! What part of the game is that?! In addition, I injured my foot while staying there (totally my fault) but when I asked the front desk for a first aid kid, THEY DIDN'T HAVE ONE!!! Foolishness of the highest order! Luckily, I had a friend that used to work for Starwood Hotels Corporate office and gave me the e mail of the CEO of the company. I sent him a lengthy note about the lack of quality at this hotel. They made it up to me with a fruit plate, a new chair (from the lobby) in my room and free internet for the remainder of my stay.
reviews.title: One of my favorite retreats

aka: The Westin Atlanta North At Perimeter Hotel Atlanta
description: Our hotel is less than 30 minutes from downtown and the city's major attractions. Situated on a private lake, guests will be sure to enjoy this tranquil retreat from the city.
